attributes.action: enforce legally the requirement for ISPs to maintain net neutrailty.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Data should be free and information equally accessible to all. The current statements made by the new Virgin Media CEO opens up the possibility of ISPs charging providers for serving their content with priority over others. This needs to be stopped with government legislation to ensure ISPs remain neutral to all involved parties.

The undersigned want legislation imposed upon Telecom companies and Internet Service Providers whereby they are explicitly unable to discriminate on content or service and still maintain a quality of service by via blank Acceptable Use Policy restrictions to specific users.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
